instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
threads.message: I had a return cross my bench.  The original repair was <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> were out of spec.  " not close to 10 ohms ".  Well it's back and they are bad once more.   I assume I have to replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> but wanted feed back from others out there.  I don't understand how <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> could fail like this.  The original repair lasted for three weeks before failing again.  I have measured both of these lines to ground and resistance is infinite.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
threads.message: In the future should I change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> when I discover failure on <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> just to be safe?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
threads.message: Apart of both caps, only <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> can cause problems there...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
threads.message: I always replace the ISL if the sense resistors are blown

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Battery current monitoring 10 ohm resistor eating bitch)
threads.message: ok. I will start replacing the ISL. They are not that expensive.  LOL I could get some big honking resistors and put them on there.   Blow that MacBook .
